paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses variants in the KCNH2 gene, specifically focusing on the K525N and F627Y mutations, their functional implications, and penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 1 presented with syncope and QT prolongation at age 25.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with LQT2 after family screening
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 2 was diagnosed with LQT2 at age 38 after family screening.
Case 3 had a history of arrhythmias and was diagnosed at age 21.

individual_records.phenotype_details: no symptoms but carries the variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Case 4 is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: K525N mutation leads to inwardly rectifying non-deactivating current.

variants.segregation_data: The K525N variant segregates with LQT2 in affected family members.
variants.additional_notes: The K525N variant is associated with significant functional changes in the hERG channel.
key_quotes: K525N mediated an inwardly rectifying non-deactivating current upon hyperpolarization.
K525N&F627Y was still inhibited by pore blockers, dofetilide, and E4031.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
